revised_title: Presynaptic Active Zones in Three Different Types of Fibers in Frog Muscle
tldr: The study investigates the presynaptic active zones in slow, fast, and intermediate types of frog muscle fibers. The research reveals differences in the deployment of active zones in motor nerve-endings, which may be determined by the type of nerve that innervates them. The findings suggest that both the morphology and physiology of the end-plates are influenced by the nerves that connect them.
